subject: Re: Which lexical set is the second vowel of _because_ in?
msgSnippet: Hi As a Canadian, I pronounce because as b kuz. just bee kuz, I can. It is probably the same for the General American pronunciation of the mid and far west.
messageBody:
Hi
As a Canadian, I pronounce because as
b'kuz. just bee kuz, I can.
It is probably the same for the General American pronunciation of
the mid and far west.
Regards, Paul V.
_____________________attached___________________
--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "peter_r_guinness"
<malt99@...> wrote:
>
> Is the second syllable vowel of _because_ in the THOUGHT set?
> In "Longman's Pronunciation Dictionary" for RP it is listed as
either
> /Q/ or /@/, and for GA it is /A:/, /Q:/, /V/ or /@/.
> I'm guessing it is a THOUGHT member even though the RP in
Longman's
> doesn't have an /O/ alternative which is the most common (normally
> only) one for THOUGHT words in RP.
>
